pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [d00831306b](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19495/commits/d00831306be2d92268f307ad2885f7531e8bedd2)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Submonoid.Finsupp` (new file)|603|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Subgroup.Finsupp` (new file)|606|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ prod_zpow`
`++ exists_finsupp_of_mem_closure_range`
`++ exists_of_mem_closure_range`
`++ mem_closure_range_iff`
`++ mem_closure_range_iff_of_fintype`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

:v: erdOne can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

@alreadydone I don't see a direct way to obtain the results in this PR from the lemmas you mentioned, or to golf those lemmas by these new results, so I'm not entirely sure what you are suggesting here.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12527256257/job/34940657745)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12527256257/job/34940657635)
It's just a comment and this PR looks good to me!

These results are very similar to [Algebra.adjoin_range_eq_range_freeAlgebra_lift](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/FreeAlgebra.html#Algebra.adjoin_range_eq_range_freeAlgebra_lift) and [Algebra.adjoin_range_eq_range_aeval](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/MvPolynomial/Basic.html#Algebra.adjoin_range_eq_range_aeval): they're essentially saying that `  ` is the universal/free AddCommMonoid/-module and `  ` is the universal/free AddCommGroup/-module. We already have [Finsupp.range_linearCombination](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/LinearAlgebra/Finsupp/LinearCombination.html#Finsupp.range_linearCombination) in the module setting, but that requires much more imports (469 vs 595), and doesn't give you the multiplicative version directly.
It's just a comment and this PR looks good to me!

I think linearCombination is defeq to Finsupp.sum, so the additive version of this can probability be golfed using [Finsupp.range_linearCombination](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/LinearAlgebra/Finsupp/LinearCombination.html#Finsupp.range_linearCombination). However as I said it requires too many imports and doesn't give you the multiplicative version.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: add `Submonoid.mem_closure_range_iff`

### PR summary [d00831306b](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19495/commits/d00831306be2d92268f307ad2885f7531e8bedd2)

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Submonoid.Finsupp` (new file)|603|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Subgroup.Finsupp` (new file)|606|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ prod_zpow`
`++ exists_finsupp_of_mem_closure_range`
`++ exists_of_mem_closure_range`
`++ mem_closure_range_iff`
`++ mem_closure_range_iff_of_fintype`
<details>

```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
```

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

:v: erdOne can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

These results are very similar to [Algebra.adjoin_range_eq_range_freeAlgebra_lift](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/FreeAlgebra.html#Algebra.adjoin_range_eq_range_freeAlgebra_lift) and [Algebra.adjoin_range_eq_range_aeval](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/MvPolynomial/Basic.html#Algebra.adjoin_range_eq_range_aeval): they're essentially saying that `  ` is the universal/free AddCommMonoid/-module and `  ` is the universal/free AddCommGroup/-module. We already have [Finsupp.range_linearCombination](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/LinearAlgebra/Finsupp/LinearCombination.html#Finsupp.range_linearCombination) in the module setting, but that requires much more imports (469 vs 595), and doesn't give you the multiplicative version directly.

@alreadydone I don't see a direct way to obtain the results in this PR from the lemmas you mentioned, or to golf those lemmas by these new results, so I'm not entirely sure what you are suggesting here.
It's just a comment and this PR looks good to me!

Pull request successfully merged into master.
